Name: KarahCrisis
Title: Maybe run a pinch small
Body: These are exactly as described. My only issue is, they are awfully tight. I'm usually a small in most gloves, but these are tighter. I have very little hands. Other than that, they are comparable to quality of the ones I have used from the oncology unit for my son who needs latex free. They were packaged nicely, box in fine shape upon receipt and very durable. They beyond serve their purpose. Next time I'll get a medium. They're still usable, so I'm not totally complaining. Just trying to help out with sizing. You may need to go with size up.

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022

Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.

They were packaged nicely, box in fine shape upon receipt and very durable. They beyond serve their purpose. Next time I'll get a medium. They're still usable, so I'm not totally complaining. Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.

Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022

As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Time: Reviewed in the United States ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ on September 23, 2022

Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022

Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

Body: I have to agree with the reviewer, who said they "smell like dog poop". Actually, I can't say exactly what they smell like, I can't pin it down, maybe rubber and poop? When I read that review, I said, "sure, right, uh huh" and ordered, because I've used this brand before. As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.

Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

Body: I have to agree with the reviewer, who said they "smell like dog poop". Actually, I can't say exactly what they smell like, I can't pin it down, maybe rubber and poop? When I read that review, I said, "sure, right, uh huh" and ordered, because I've used this brand before. As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022

Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

Name: Windancer
Title: Agreed, they have terrible odor!
Body: I have to agree with the reviewer, who said they "smell like dog poop". Actually, I can't say exactly what they smell like, I can't pin it down, maybe rubber and poop? When I read that review, I said, "sure, right, uh huh" and ordered, because I've used this brand before. As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...
Time: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.

Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

Name: Windancer
Title: Agreed, they have terrible odor!
Body: I have to agree with the reviewer, who said they "smell like dog poop". Actually, I can't say exactly what they smell like, I can't pin it down, maybe rubber and poop? When I read that review, I said, "sure, right, uh huh" and ordered, because I've used this brand before. As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...
Time: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2022

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Time: Reviewed in the United States ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ on September 23, 2022

Title: Very cheap
Body: You do pay for what you get and these are incredibly thin and cheap. However they were the cheapest ones I could find for the quantity. It all depends on what you want to do with these. Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

Title: Agreed, they have terrible odor!
Body: I have to agree with the reviewer, who said they "smell like dog poop". Actually, I can't say exactly what they smell like, I can't pin it down, maybe rubber and poop? When I read that review, I said, "sure, right, uh huh" and ordered, because I've used this brand before. As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.

Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

Name: Windancer
Title: Agreed, they have terrible odor!
Body: I have to agree with the reviewer, who said they "smell like dog poop". Actually, I can't say exactly what they smell like, I can't pin it down, maybe rubber and poop? When I read that review, I said, "sure, right, uh huh" and ordered, because I've used this brand before. As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...
Time: Reviewed in the United States ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ on February 21, 2022

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022

Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

Body: I have to agree with the reviewer, who said they "smell like dog poop". Actually, I can't say exactly what they smell like, I can't pin it down, maybe rubber and poop? When I read that review, I said, "sure, right, uh huh" and ordered, because I've used this brand before. As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2022

Name: Gene S.
Title: 4mil thick gloves,  Medium size can also fit Large hand
Body: These 4mil thick gloves stretch without breaking like inferior thin "cheap" gloves.But they are priced to provide a great value for the money.  I purchased the Medium size due to the requests (or demands :-) ) of the females in our household.  Per Comfy''s size guide, the Medium gloves can also fit many Large hands. So I purchased only Mediums and tried them on my Large hands. They did fit and covered the palm of my hand extending about an inch past the edge. This is okay for my use and saves additional money buying only one size. But if you are using liquids (cleaning, washing, mopping, etc.) you may want to buy the Large gloves also. That will extend more past the edge of your hand, lowering the possibility of getting liquids under the glove. Either way, the gloves are durable and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022

Name: Leah ğŸ’›
Title: Kitchen trash bags are thicker than these! (?1mil?)
Body: Nowhere in the description, here or manufacturers website, did I find a specification of the thickness. I took a chance and ordered because my previous brand - regular ol' painters gloves (if they're not sealed and labeled as medically sterile, they're painters gloves in my opinion) that were about 4mil - had increased substantially in price. I wanted thicker because the 4mil do rip at the cuffs easily when putting on/pulling off with too much force and a sliver of a natural fingernail will slit the tips super easily, often). These are ***maybe*** 3 mil (do they make 1 mil because I feel certain my trash bags are more durable than these). If I had to guess I would guess 1 mil.SAVE YOUR MONEY UNLESS YOU JUST WANT THEM FOR ON/OFF AT THE GAS PUMP or something similarly quick and unlikely to rip them.

As, soon as I tore open the plastic wrapping the boxes came in, I could begin to smell something strange. When I tore open the box, the odor came at me strong and it spread throughout the room.  Back they go. A lot of things have changed during this pandemic. Companies change how they manufacture. I am not sensitive to odors or chemicals and can take a lot. So, I don't know what's up with these gloves, but the off-gassing is "really, really" bad. They are just gloves, go figure? If there was anything wrong, I expected it to be that they were torn or tore easily or something like that. Anyway, I had to put them outside. Please don't order these if you have children at home. Just saying...

Name: db
Title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION - NOT 4 MIL
Body: The gloves are actually decent - pretty durable, size seems right, inexpensive.  I just can't abide a seller making a claim that is a blatant lie.  These gloves are NOT 4 mil.  It was obvious when I pulled the first one from the box and could literally see my hand through it before putting it on.  I took one to work to mic it - they are 2 mil.Now, I am keeping them because of the reasons with which I opened this review, and because a thinner glove allows you to feel what you're doing better than a thick one (great for more detailed automotive work).  I just don't like it when sellers lie to people, hence the review.  You have been informed.

Name: Christopher
Title: Fan favorite among the dogs!
Body: Happy pets are the goal. These treats surpass expectations with every purchase.Anyone at our door receives barking. Oddly, when the driver delivers a box of Milk-Bone treats, silent, immense wagging is the response.I swear they smell them before the truck door ever opens. While I do not eat them, I have to say that they taste absolutely GREAT based on the reactions from our canine roommates.Every box arrives sealed, it's contents fresh and crunchy. The smell brings back memories from the mid to late 80's, so I am certain the recipe is as good as always.The dogs send their gratitude and thanks, along with a little bit of slobber. I send my thanks because I absolutely love when pets are happy. Milk-Bone is a winner as far as I am concerned. I highly recommend these treats.

Name: Snowbutch1
Title: Bought to make dog treats
Body: My pups love dried chicken and I love them having it.  However, I was very leery of ones made out of the US so looked for a better solution.  I do dehydrate thin slices but my pups are little pigs and gobble it up faster than I can hand it to them.  I tried the ones with chew bones and chicken wrapped and they loved those but wasn't crazy about what might be in the bones.  Milk Bones have been a staple for years so decided to try wrapping these in chicken strips to dehydrate.  What a perfect treat.  They can't gobble them up in one bite so they at least taste what they are eating and also the benefit of chewing the bone for their teeth....it's super easy to make these and my little dogs love them....This big box will keep them in treats for months so great deal for the cost

Name: Mmlmail
Title: My dog loves fresh Milk-bones.
Body: These would get 5 stars but the package arrived opened, a bit stale with a few missing bones.  I kept it anyhow, my dog thinks they are still great.The large bones are around 4-5â€ long.  If your dog is over 80 lbs I suggest the extra large ones.I have never found a dog that turned these down.Delivery people are known to keep a box in their carts.My 80 lb youngster loves these.  She knows where they are stored and will often sit by the box looking at me with pleading eyes.My older dog has pancreatitis- finding treats for her can be difficult.If your dog has that condition is as important to know what not buy as what to buy.BOTH CALCIUM and FAT can set off an attack. These have loads of calcium, so they are off limits. Try to find VERY low fat chicken treats without calcium for that condition.

Amazon's review page asks for a rating for "freshness" and "flavor".  omg.  How can one tell if a hard-as-a-brick dog bone is fresh?  As for flavor, well, I won't go there.  I only wish that I could somehow close the box.  It will take a while to go through all these and there is no type of closure on the box.

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Stella loves these.
Body: We adopted Stella in Nov. Our Boston Terrier + Chiweenie both needed being put down in Oct. Our Boston Bull had cancer, that we'd known was needed. Our Chiweenie had nasty teeth + breath + needed over  $2,000 was too old to get his oral surgery + @ that age, had him put down also.2 wks later we adopted Stella. 60lbs + a challenge. Her teeth are perfectly white though. She'd spent 11 months in the shelter. She was instantly Mama's little girl @ 6 yrs old. Our 2 put down were very yippy. Stella doesn't make a noise. Only one bark as a warning. She also knows when we order pizza, giving us her one, warning bark. We loveWe didn't know about needed oral care other than give her soft treats + human food.Now we know better, buying expensive grocery store treats + our, human food.Now Stella has the whitest teeth. Besides feeding her Milk Bones + every treat now is good for her.But what really whiteness her teeth was a dog water additive. One capfull per pint of water. We actually found her teeth getting whiter almost immediately. She's spoiled crazy here. Lots of toys, love + treats. She doesn't like other dogs so knew she'd need $3000 fencing ASAP.She loves her new yard + us. We were told no 2nd dog with her. She's great with humans but will bite any other dog.(BAD doggie.)I'm 65 + love her to  pieces. Gr8 for protection + loveThe hubby works nites + we'd had a portrait stolen from our porch. Now instead of a real dog's barking, had our 2 Yippers. At 3am, the thieves actually shined their flash light through our front door @  the 3 of us.They must've been ticked off upon opening the box, finding only a measly pic. of me as a teen showing Dancer, my Tennessee Walking horse.With Stella, I think they would've left w/o my pic. of Dancer + me. Her bark can be intimidating + even our 2 Yippers, didn't make a sound back then. They were scared too.She loves every treat offered to her. I remember eating a Milk Bone when I was 4-5 yrs. We bought Stella the lg sz + she loves EVERYTHING!!
Time: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020

Name: Dawn Maynor
Title: My 4 Dogs All-Time Favorite 'Snack Food'
Body: Ohhh- milk bones. What do you put in your products, Milk-Bone?! Because my dogs just can't get enough! I have three malamute mixes and a pitbull. Three of my four dogs are not picky eaters what-so-ever, but one of my dogs is a downright queen when it comes to her food. She needs everything 'just perfect' and will stick her nose up to most foods I try to feed her. Milk bones, though? She'll never turn up her nose to a milk bone! And that's saying a lot- because she rarely eats anything.So what exactly are 'milk bones'? Well, they're a dog treat comprised of mostly grain, some meat by products, and ya- a little bit of milk (which I'm guessing is where they got their name). Do they offer any nutritional value for your dog? Very little. And they're definitely not something that should be a main part of your dog's diet. But as a small daily treat, they're great. Look at them in the same way you'd look at cookies for a human. Are they great? No. But they're totally fine in moderation. These milk bones are shaped just like a bone and come in different sizes and flavors. I all of the sizes and all of the flavors. My dogs love every single on of them, but for this specific purchase I bought the 'Medium' original flavor in the 10 pound box. The box is HUGE and there are a good 200 or so bones inside. Great for multi-dog families!The bones are durable and crunchy. A perfect way to help clean your dogs teeth by removing plaque and debris that make be stuck between teeth near the gums. Hard crunchy snacks act as a natural tooth brush for dogs and milk bones are the perfect crunchy texture to 'scrape away' unwanted remnants left from canned and soft foods. The bones are so hard that they don't break apart in transit. These hold up exceptionally well being shipped and very few (I'd say about 2%) of the bones in my huge box were broken. Almost all of them were in perfect condition.My' picky eater' pup loves these and I use them while training her. My other three dogs also adore these- but aren't quite as picky of eaters so their opinion isn't as quite as meaningful. I'm a huge fan of Milk-Bone. Their products are made in the USA and are always top quality. They're a trusted brand that I continue to return to time and time again- and for good reason. My dogs love these treats. I love these treats. And in terms of 'snacks bars for pets' - milk bones take the cake (pun intended).
Time: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2016

Name: Careful Shopper
Title: Good Enough For Molly
Body: Milk Bone dog biscuits are second only to things-she-should-never-eat in Mollie's pantheon of treats.  For some reason we humans can never comprehend, my very  doggy 57 pound, two year old, lab mix, prefers day-old  recently used dog food  as her snack of choice.  Our neighborhood is a cafeteria despite the law. As soon as she is let off leash in Central Park she makes a beeline for the nearest pile as regular as the clockwork.  "Leave it" screamed in a rising voice only works after her tasting has started.  At home, I have offered her a selection of Zuke's treats, smelly cheese, freeze dried liver, and sometimes, a lick of the knife I just used to spread peanut butter.  If I hold the treat in one hand and a milk bone in the other, most of the time she ignores the treat and gently takes the Milk Bone.  It doesn't matter if I have broken the Milk Bone and the size is small.  She has no discrimination based on size, just smell.In my Upper West Side neighborhood, here in NYC, the sidewalks are crowded with dogs.  Most, like mine, seem to be rescues, but many are show quality, and we owners congregate in the local dog run and talk about, what else, dogs.Tooth cleaning around here with general anesthesia can push four figures and is a popular procedure with dogs that eat home cooked food, "raw diet" diets, gourmet refrigerated pet food etc.  My Molly has been raised on Blue Buffalo dry food in various flavors, and we always have a ten pound box of Milk Bones hands.  When she cleans up her plate, or does a reasonably good job, she is rewarded with a Milk Bone.  They are a wonderful training aid and can be broken in small pieces so you don't overfeed.  The point is that my Molly has shiny white teeth and a sweet breath and has never been fed table scraps or gourmet foods.When using Amazon Prime, the Milk Bone comes in at half the price of buying locally.  Can't beat that.
Time: Reviewed in the United States ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ on September 19, 2012

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Multiple orders infested with pill bugs. Not a one-time issue.
Body: Pill bugs started showing up all over the place in my kitchen because they were coming out of the box of Milk Bones I received from my Amazon Subscription. Thinking, these things happen, I guess, I decided to let it go and received my next box a month later. Guess what I found... more pill bugs. I know they are from the biscuits because there are extra little holes in every biscuit where they burrowed out. I shook a couple live bugs out of a biscuit, too. Gross. Just gross. I've read that I can freeze them for a couple days, but I don't have that kind of freezer space. I could bake them, but that thought also grosses me out - will they start wriggling out of the biscuits as they die? YUCK... I guess I'm not too worried about my dogs eating them (they are real doggy dogs and will eat much worse things than that if I let them, but do I want to KNOW that I'm feeding them buggy biscuits every time I'm handing out biscuits, even if I did bake them to kill the bugs? Nope. Also, I'm not too thrilled with finding pill bugs everywhere as they try to infest my other foods. They even ended up in the fridge somehow and were still alive (just really slow)! Ugh. I gave one star for being repeatedly full of bugs and one extra star because my dogs do like them - maybe because they have that extra buggy spice!
Time: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2022

Name: Pam
Title: Beware! Full of Ants!  But there is a Solution!
Body: First, please know that my dog loves Milk Bones and I love Amazon!  That is why I gave this review 5 stars overall.  The problem is that when I opened this particular box, it was full of tiny little ants.  Since I brought the product inside as soon as it was delivered, I can only assume the ants got in the box during transit.  But do not despair!  The solution is to ask Amazon to ship Milk Bones in an Amazon box, which they will do at no additional cost.  The Amazon shipping boxes are sealed in a more secure manner than shipping in the Milk Bones box only.  I have ordered Milk Bones many times before and they were shipped in Amazon boxes.  This is the first time I have seen ants in an Amazon delivered product.  I also tossed the product since I did not want to take ants to the UPS store for an Amazon return.

Name: Chaos & Coffee
Title: Training tools!!
Body: I have 5 dogs that fall into the medium dog category. I have recently started babysitting my brothers dog and he is young!! Teething, chewing, and getting into trouble all the time and adorable enough to get by with most of it.I keep these on hand for a bedtime cookie for my gang but right now we are going through these like kleenex during allergy season. He gets one in exchange for his no no chews. Every time he gives up an item he isn't supposed to have, or sits, or shakes, or potties outside, boom! A milkbone in the mouth! He doesn't get a whole one because I don't want him to explode. I think that would probably make the news and I don't need that hassle.These are perfect training tools. I break the "ears" off first and then break the body. They seem to break easier that way. They are very crumby though so don't do this in your bed. You will have crumbs in the bed until you change the sheets. They hide until you're comfortable and then suddenly the bed is covered in them.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020

Time: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2022

Name: Elizabeth
Title: Great treat for ravenous eaters
Body: I bought these as a Christmas gift for my roommate's dog. She is a hungry, hungry 2-year old pitbull mix. Most small treats she swallows whole and I always feel like she doesn't really appreciate the treat since she doesn't take time to savor it. These large treats are very crunchy and a good, sturdy size. They take her about 15 seconds to eat and then she snorts up the crumbs and then licks my hands clean of any lingering flavor. Much better than the 1 second it takes her to swallow a small treat. She really seems to love them. They are big enough that sometimes I break them in half and she still gets a decent sized treat.I may be acting a bit overprotective but since they are very hard bones and her first bite always breaks the bone into several choking sized pieces, I do make sure to watch her eat the entire bone so she doesn't try to swallow a hard/jagged piece whole and get it lodged in her throat. She seems to be smarter than that but I would definitely caution against giving this as a treat and then heading out the door for work before the dog finishes it. You never know. I do the same type of thing with my cats though so maybe I'm just overprotective in general.Since they are very large, dense and hard I would suggest only getting them for dogs that are both big and strong. If your dog COULD BE considered medium or is an older dog with a weaker jaw, you may want to try the smaller sized treats. For a strong jawed, energetic young pitbull, they are perfect.
Time: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2015

Name: CGR
Title: good for big dogs
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
                



Â 
Â We have a 3 year old great pyrenees who we got from someone a year or so ago.  He is not only a wanderer, but being raised hands off, when he met our neighbors with young boys who scratched on him all the time, he kinda decided he likes them better.  We have asked them to shoo him back over here.  We live in the country, it is not as if they live close by.  We cannot even see their house.  So now, my husband says I am bribing the dog.  I said ... YES, I am.  The neighbors don't feed him so I have at least one thing up on them.  He comes home for dinner and if he comes home at others times, I give him these Milk Bones as treats.  We are starting to win the battle.  I would just throw my hands up at get rid of him all together, but he keeps the coyotes away for everyone.Anyway ... good price and value. Better then local grocery store prices.  Ample sized box could last 1-3 months for us.  Arrived super quick.  Good size for big dogs like Toby the Great Pyrenees.  They are 4" long x 1-1.5" wide.Would purchase again.
Time: Reviewed in the United States ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ on November 15, 2016

As for my trying them out,  ... maybe if our society fails to improve,  we may all be eating these in place of 'pizza-bites'. Name: Mary B.
Title: I am very sensitive what I buy for our fur babies, they mean the world to me.
Body: I am very sensitive what I buy for our fur babies, they mean the world to me.  I have tried the Costco version, but find that they tend to give our border collies diarrhea, so I am only going to give them these Milk Bones in the future.Our vet said that these biscuits are a good treat, that not only makes our dogs happy, it actually helps to keep down the tartar on their teeth, and have some vitamins as well. I feed them a Milk Bone after their dinner to help clean their teeth.Our dogs weigh between 43 to 47 pounds and I buy the large size of Milk Bones.  I have this order under subscribe and save every 2 months so that I don't run out.I hope that you have found my opinion and images to be helpful with your decision process to purchase this item. If this is the case, and where Amazon asks if this review helpful, please click "yes".IngredientsWheat Flour, Meat and Bone Meal, Wheat Bran, Milk, Beef Fat (Preserved with BHA), Salt, Natural Flavor, Dicalcium Phosphate, Wheat Germ, Calcium Carbonate, Brewerâ€™s Dried Yeast, Malted Barley Flour, Sodium Metabisulfite (Used as a Preservative), Choline Chloride, Minerals (Ferrous Sulfate, Zinc Oxide, Manganous Oxide, Copper Sulfate, Calcium Iodate, Sodium Selenite), Vitamins (Vitamin E Supplement, Vitamin A Supplement, Niacin Supplement, D-Calcium Pantothenate, Riboflavin Supplement, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Vitamin D3 Supplement, Folic Acid, Biotin, Vitamin B12 Supplement), BHA (Used as a Preservative).

Name: Sparky
Title: Reviews are Important to Me...
Body: I wasn't able to get anything intelligible from either of my three dogs in regards to 'Freshness' or 'Flavor'.  However, given how important a review is I did not let them stop me.I put them in a blender briefly and added them to my 14-year-old boy's Golden Grahams.  He wolfed it down so quickly I am not sure if it is a valid test of either category but I'll err on the side of the product.  Five stars for Freshness and flavor.  Note:  It did NOT freshen his breath...I also chopped them into smaller chunks and dipped them into chocolate for the rest of the family (except myself as I don't want to be biased).  They were a huge success in terms of being fresh and the flavor.As a side note, my wife discovered the testing material after my experiments and I'm in search of a softer couch.

Title: Could be better
Body: Overall, these treats are fine, BUT they could be better. The treats come in just a cardboard box. Thatâ€™s it. Iâ€™ve read on here that people were finding bugs in these treats, but I have not experienced that. It would be very easy for insects to get into this box since it is only a box with treats thrown in it. I would love if they could put a plastic bag in this box before the treats to keep them protected from intruders.Once this box comes, I put all the treats in gallon ziplock bags (about three bags) to keep what freshness they have and also to keep intruders out. Since they come in 10 pound box, it takes us about a year to go though them with just our one good boy. We also break these treats in half to help our dogs weight and itâ€™s easier for him to consume.

Name: Don MacMurray
Title: Infested with mealworms...
Body: My entire pantries was infested with mealworms that originated with this box of dog biscuits.  How do I know? Because I put some of the biscuits in a sealed, plastic container to take on a trip with my dog. When we got home, the pantry was crawling with these bugs. I looked in the box of biscuits and saw them crawling in the box and there were tiny holes in the biscuits in random places.  I then looked into the sealed container and found the same bugs with the same type of holes in the biscuits.  I don't know where the shipment came from but these biscuits mush have been sitting in a warehouse that must be infested with mealworms.

Name: KinIA
Title: My dogs like them....but
Body: My dog loves them so good enough BUT.... not from Amazon but at xmas there was a really good buy and i got 5 boxes. Since I've had problems in the past with bugs (thinking from somewhere in my house), I wrapped them in garbage bags, separately. When I open a new box they go into an airtight container. I take out a pound at a time and put them in a smaller jar, easier to grab and my pups know both containers. I feel with the two airtight storage options that I would avoid those darn bugs. I got them again on the 4th box in the 4th month. I was so frustrated! I spoke with a friend who happens to be a vet in So Cal and they have had the same problem. The bugs are in THE BISCUITS!! This has happened several times and I would never have guessed that. So, only order 1 at a time and keep them stored properly or you will be as frustrated as I was/am. I should stop buying them but I like that they are hard and think they are good (as a treat can be) for their teeth. So ONE BOX AT A TIME and only small boxes if you have a smaller dog. Or better, don't buy so your dog won't ingest something live in some form.â˜†â˜†â˜†UPDATEâ˜†â˜†â˜† I have spoken with the Milk-Bone customer service and was offered no solution (but a coupon) or responsibility even though I repeated several times that I don't want coupons, I wanted answers. You decide if you want to support this product but with the tepid response both on the phone and in email, no more bones.FYI, this has happened on 2 different coasts, 3 times over 20+ years. It took my friend, the vet, to help me understand it was not me or anything I did OR anything to do with cleanliness, they're IN the biscuits at time of purchase. I hope this ends your guilt about getting bugs in your home, you're doing nothing wrong and your house is clean. And yes, I feel stupid for not realizing that the bones are infested but who would think that? Thank you my wonderful former veterinarian.Hope the pictures help.Search Milk-Bone Biscuits with bugs and see how many videos there are. No wonder they don't say anything when you contact them about the problem. Very sad!
Time: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2018

Name: By On By
Title: Good deal on dog biscuits - but this box isn't re-closable.
Body: These seem to be just like the ones I have been buying in the grocery store, except at the grocery store I'm buying smaller boxes for more money.  My dog seems to approve of them - so this is definitely the better deal.I see that some other reviews mention these being overpriced or available for less elsewhere - but prices fluctuate on Amazon, so it's hard to know what these were priced at the time.  When I purchased these they were a great deal.The reason for only 4 stars is that this giant box doesn't have any inside bag or any other way to re-close the box. The box just comes taped shut with one piece of packing tape. It will take months for my dog to eat all of these, so it would be much better if there were some way to close the box back up.  I can't keep them in this box because they will get stale and could attract insects or mice.  I had to repackage them in several smaller containers and sealed bags.

Title: Big hit with my 55 pound mutt!!
Body: My dog loves to have these milk bones stuck inside her large kong toy and they are the perfect size to stick in there and keep her busy for a few minutes. I don't usually give them to her whole as a treat because I feel like they are kind of big for a treat especially if you treat your dog through out the day and you're not supposed to give them more than somewhere along the lines of 5 a day, she's about 55 pounds. She has not had any health problems or anything related to giving her these treats but that's just her and every dog is different so if you're trying them out for the first time make sure to watch how they react to them like any new foods. I don't know how long they are made to last for but it takes us a good 6 months or more to go through a box of these with her getting a few a week and I haven't had a problem with them going bad or anything like that.

Name: B. Renee
Title: Perfect size. Healthy treats.
Body: When the box first arrived I was a little concerned since the box looked like it had just received a beating. I still decided to try the treats and I am so glad I did because my dogs absolutely loved them. I like how the biscuits are large so it keeps them busy for a while. My dogs are all about 40 lbs and these treats are perfect for them. I have tried other large biscuits in the past but they are too thin and easily break. These are thick and hard to break with my hands which means they keep my dogs busy for a slightly longer time. Each biscuit is about 125 calories which is a great way to add a few calories to my skinny dog's diet-- She is super active so she's on the thinner side. These also help keep dogs teeth clean because they are so crunchy. My dogs don't like having their teeth brushed so it's awesome to have treats that will help remove some of the tartar--Of course these don't replace frequent brushing, but they help. Oh, and they are made in the US!
Time: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2015

Name: KG
Title: Our big dogs love these
Body: We buy a box of these every month or so, our big dogs love them! They know they're  supposed to sit before they get a treat so every morning they'll be sitting in the kitchen with big goofy grins on their faces waiting for their bones while I grab a cup of coffee. These bones are crunchy and seem to help with keeping our dogs teeth nice and clean, breath not so much.There isn't any liner inside of the box, it's just the bones inside of the box taped shut so we usually just transfer the bones into gallon baggies  for garage refrigerator storage then fill a treat container for the house as needed. Breakage during shipping isn't that bad, the dogs love the broken ones just as much as the non broken. When they hear the treat container our two house ponies come running!

Title: What Have I Been Waiting For?
Body: I have been a dog owner for quite some time.  My newest dog has got some great teeth and I didn't know what option to go with. I've been going to the local pet stores and asking what they recommended, then I was just asking dog owner and they said to go with Milk Bone.I have to say, Milk Bone - You Got It!  This is what you guys do and you guys got it right.  My dog had it, she was super excited and her breathe immediately was better.  My dog is about 20 pounds and she was so happy to get her treat and I was happy her breath was so much better.  Double Win!!!  Thank you Milk Bone!!!

Body: I was worried after reading previous reviews, then realized they were all over a year old, so I decided to try it. I regret nothing. The bones came bug free and my dog loves them. Several times I watched my dog go up to the box, open it with his nose and get himself some treats. The look he gave me when he realized I had seen him do it, a kid caught with their hands in the cookie jar. It was hilarious. I was finally able to rearrange the platform so that my dog doesn't go through months worth of bones in a week.
